text:
The lights of the stalls and lanterns shine in the
darkness of the night, and many people, a clamor.
Between the light and sound, the two walk hand in hand.

name: Barrel
text:
W-Wow...!
This cotton candy is so big,
sweet, and delicious!!

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Is that so? That's great.
If it's not enough, just say so, and
Grandma will share mine with you.

name: Barrel
text:
Thanks, Grandma!
By the way, that mask,
when did you buy it?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
At the stall next to the cotton candy's.
When I found a mask of my favorite character,
I just had to buy it.

name: Barrel
text:
Favorite...?
Grandma, is that from the old movie
you always watch at home?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Yes, that's it!!
The righteous police officer hero, who hides his face under a fox mask,
and with a pair of jitte, he shouts 'You're under arrest!' against the great evil...!

name: Barrel
text:
Under arrest! Hehe, that's so cool!!
I want to see it when we get back... Oh.
Grandma, that kid...!

At the end of the path Barrel pointed to,
a small child was staring at the ground,
with tears in his eyes.

name: Child's Voice
text:
Ugh...
*sniffle*...

He must have fallen, his clothes were dirty,
and where his tear-filled eyes were looking, a cotton candy,
similarly soiled with dirt, was rolling.

name: Barrel
text:
That kid... poor thing.
Oh, I know...!

The child's empty hand, and
his own hand grasping the cotton candy.
Barrel looks at them alternately.

name: Barrel
text:
Hey...! ...Ah.
But... Um...

And Barrel looks down,
his face filled with sadness,
and retracts the hand he was about to offer.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Oh my, oh my, that's enough crying.
Look, look, your cotton candy
came back all big!

At that moment, Barrel's grandmother,
standing next to him, ran up to the child
and offered him the cotton candy she was holding.

name: Child's Voice
text:
Eh...?
Um, grandma, can I
really have this?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
That's right, after something sad happens,
something happy always comes after.
Now, be careful not to fall next time, okay?

name: Child's Voice
text:
Okay!
Thank you, grandma!!

She gently pats the child's head, and the child,
now smiling, is gently pushed on the back and seen off.
And, in the direction she turned to look—

name: Barrel
text:
...! Uuu...!
Grandma, I...!

As if the child's tears had been contagious,
this time Barrel was the one looking down, and his tears
were creating small stains on the ground.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Oh my, oh my!
It seems the tears that just stopped
have moved over here.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
...Won't you tell me, Barrel?
Why are you crying?

Wiping away his flowing tears with
a handkerchief, and gently stroking his head,
Barrel's grandmother quietly asks him.

name: Barrel
text:
Because... I was going to give him my
cotton candy, but I didn't give it to him...
So Grandma, your share... I'm sorry...!

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
You don't have to apologize.
I told you, didn't I? Grandma's cotton candy
went to deliver happiness to that child.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
So there's nothing to worry about.
...But, well. Can you tell me,
why did you pull your hand back then?

Continuing to stroke his head to
calm him down, with a gentle smile,
Barrel's grandmother quietly asks him.

name: Barrel
text:
I really wanted to give that kid
my cotton candy. Because I thought,
it would make him happy...

name: Barrel
text:
But... In a place with so many people,
if I gave him my cotton candy, I'd stand out.
And that's a bad thing...

name: Barrel
text:
And, this cotton candy,
you bought it for me, Grandma.

name: Barrel
text:
If I just gave it away,
this time Grandma would be sad...
I thought so.

Calmed down by his grandmother's stroking,
Barrel, whose tears had finally subsided,
spits out his feelings.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
...I see.
Barrel, you're not just kind,
you're a really good and proper boy.

With that, she gently hugs Barrel,
and pats Barrel's back gently,
at the same rhythm.

name: Barrel
text:
.........
Grandma, but...

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
What your parents say is right,
they're words to protect you, a child.
And you, who can follow them, are admirable!

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
And, you thought of Grandma,
and hesitated to give your cotton candy
to that child, didn't you?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
I'll say it as many times as you want, Barrel.
You're a kind, good and proper boy.
Grandma's really proud of you!

As she says, she releases Barrel
from her hug, looks straight into
Barrel's small eyes, and speaks.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
You thought that giving your cotton candy
to that child was the right thing to do, didn't you?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
But you gave up your own 'right' for your
parents' words, and your kindness to Grandma.
To the 'right' of those around you.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Your parents, and I, and you.
Nobody is in the wrong.
And yet, the reason you're in pain is—

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Barrel, more than anyone else,
you think you're not cool.
That's what you're thinking.

name: Barrel
text:
Not cool...?
I, think that about myself?
But, that's...

At his grandmother's laughing words,
Barrel's small eyes opened wide as he replies.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
In this world, there are as many
'rights' as there are people.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
For example, to your parents,
to this Grandma of yours.
And, of course, to you too.

name: Barrel
text:
As many rights as there are people...
So, I'm right, too...?

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Of course!
You're right, and other people are right!
In that case—

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
To follow straight with what you think is right,
and to laugh with all your might.
Isn't that the coolest thing of all!?

name: Barrel
text:
I... don't really get it.
But, cool, huh?
Ehe, that sounds really nice!

name: Barrel
text:
...Well then.
Grandma, is this cool?

At his grandmother's hearty laugh,
Barrel returns a small smile, and offers
his grandmother his own cotton candy.

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Barrel...!
Ah, of course.
It's the coooolest!

name: Barrel's Grandmother
text:
Well then, Grandma will show you my cool.
Let's go, Barrel.
Let's go buy some more cotton candy!

What is right, and what is not right.
I've never known, and I still don't.
I don't have a single clue to it.

If I don't know, then I'll just follow
through with my own 'right', and laugh.
Those words are still deep in my heart—

That is what that drives me forward.
That I, am always
the coolest hero of justice.

Chapter 5:
Distant Days Carnival

options.text: I'm counting on you again today!

text:
The next morning, [Player] arrives
at Japan Pavilion, which is still projecting
a clear blue sky overhead.

And, to Turbak, who is quietly gazing
at the festival stalls, which are even
livelier than the day before, they call out.

name: Turbak
text:
[Player]-kun!?
G-Good morning!
It's another beautiful morning!!

At the sudden words,
Turbak's expression is one of surprise.
And then it changes to a downcast one.

name: Turbak
text:
...Sorry about yesterday.
We were all having so much fun,
and then I proceeded to ruin it.

options.text: Have you calmed down a little?

name: Turbak
text:
...After that, I thought about it all night.
Why did Anonymous... the Nethers,
create that festival?

name: Turbak
text:
But in the end, I still couldn't understand.
That festival is a festival for those people,
that's all I could think about it.

With a still-downcast expression,
Turbak continues to speak,
squeezing out each word.

name: Turbak
text:
I talked a little about it before.
The festival in my hometown
is no longer a thing.

name: Turbak
text:
The people of my hometown have been
celebrating the festival for a long time.
I thought it would continue onwards forever.

name: Turbak
text:
But still, the festival disappeared in just 10 years.
The number of people participating decreased due to urban development,
and we couldn't spare the time to prepare for the festival—

name: Turbak
text:
And before I knew it, it was decided that there was no
need to focus on the tourism industry, and it disappeared.
It wasn't for ourselves anymore.

options.text: It's sad to see a tradition lost.
The meaning of the festival disappeared.

name: Turbak
text:
...That's why I was sad.
That there's a festival that's not
meant to be passed down. But—

name: Turbak
text:
At the same time, I came to
understand that what Theoreol-san
said is also right.

name: Turbak
text:
...It's not something to be sad about.
My hometown is now prosperous,
and everyone is living hand in hand.

name: Turbak
text:
...There are things that have been lost,
and things that have changed their form.
But, everyone in my hometown is happy now.

As he says, with the same big
smile as when they first met,
Turbak continues to spin his words.

name: Turbak
text:
But, my own thoughts still stand!
That if everyone is enjoying the festival with a smile,
then there's no greater happiness than that!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Barrel
dialogue_after_selection.text:
It's just as [Player]-san says~!!
Let's get going now, Turbak-san!!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Barrel
dialogue_after_selection.text:
It's just as [Player]-san says~!!
Let's get going now, Turbak-san!!

options.text: I think you should see that festival more.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Barrel
dialogue_after_selection.text: Just as [Player]-san says, Turbak-san, you should see that festival again, properly this time~!

text:
As Turbak comes to a conclusion with his own words,
Barrel's voice overlaps [Player]'s reply to his conclusion.

name: Turbak
text:
Barrel-kun!?
Um, what do you mean by 'going now'...
Ah, first of all, good morning!

name: Barrel
text:
Sorry~, Turbak-san.
I was eavesdropping on
your conversation~.

name: Turbak
text:
No, I don't mind that, but
what do you mean by going
to Fortina Pavilion...?

name: Barrel
text:
Turbak-san, you've studied all about
the festivals so far, and found out
how amazing and fun they are, right~?

name: Barrel
text:
...I kind of understood why
you felt that festival wasn't
for Fortina, Turbak-san~.

name: Barrel
text:
...But, even those people must
have their own thoughts,
and their own 'right'~!

name: Barrel
text:
It might not change even if you knew,
so it's fine if that was the case~.
But...

name: Barrel
text:
I want those people,
and you too, Turbak-san.
To enjoy all the festivals~!

name: Turbak
text:
.........
It might be so, but...

At Barrel's words, Turbak looks down
with a downcast expression.
Another voice calls out to him.

name: Roudin
text:
Let's just go and see, no?
We're free today anyway.
...Right, good morning.

options.text: Were you eavesdropping, by any chance?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Roudin
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hey, hey, I just happened to overhear, okay?
Well, I was watching to see when I should call out, though.

options.text: You were waiting for the right timing, weren't you?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Roudin
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hey, hey, I just happened to overhear, okay?
Well, I was watching to see when I should call out, though.

name: Roudin
text:
...And, well.
It's not like you have
a reason not to go, right?

name: Roudin
text:
Then, maybe it wouldn't be so
bad to go to Fortina Pavilion again.
We didn't get to see it properly yesterday.

name: Roudin
text:
...I mean, Turbak.
You're going to apologize to those guys from
yesterday, right? So I'll accompany you to it?

name: Turbak
text:
Eh!?
W-wait, Roudin-san,
I was planning to, but...

name: Roudin
text:
Seeing you yesterday,
I figured you'd do that.
But, well—

name: Roudin
text:
I agree with Barrel as well,
that you should go see
that festival one more time.

As Roudin says, he smiles lightly,
and ostentatiously reads out the
schedule displayed on his device.

name: Roudin
text:
And... Oh, what a coincidence!!
There's no exchange stream scheduled for today,
and we're free until the exhibition match in the evening!

name: Barrel
text:
Okay, it's decided~!
Well then, let's head to
Fortina Pavilion!!

name: Turbak
text:
Eh, ehh!?
I'm happy, but I can't possibly make
everyone come along for my sake...

options.text: It's just an excuse to play at that festival!

name: Turbak
text:
[Player]-kun...
Everyone, I'm sorry,
and... Thank you.

Nodding at Turbak's quiet words,
the group heads to Fortina Pavilion.

name: Mafia?
text:
Gwah!?
I-I lost!?

name: Villain?
text:
...Not bad.
You're... going to be
a great hero... *gasp*.

name: Staff
text:
Congratulations!
You were a really cool hero!!
Ah, here's a commemorative item. Please accept.

Following from the previous day,
[Player] and the others visit Fortina Pavilion.

The festival was even more lively
than the day before, and the sounds of
laughter and cheers echoed throughout the venue.

name: Barrel
text:
It's super lively~!
Just watching makes
me super excited~!

name: Roudin
text:
As an organizer, I'm really grateful.
Now then. I'd like to talk to
those guys from yesterday...

Roudin takes a look around.
In his line of sight, a particularly large shadow
notices the group and approaches with a loud laugh.

name: Viscunam
text:
Gwahahaha!
To visit my pavilion two days in a row,
you sure have a good mindset!

options.text: Viscunam, good to see you again!
We're in your care again today.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Viscunam
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Don't just treat people as sets!
First, you should be weeping with emotion at being able to see me again!

text:
As Viscunam exchanges greetings,
familiar people also show
their faces from behind him.

name: Sensettia
text:
Honestly...
We was just dealing with the police,
but you're already so needlessly energetic...

name: Barrel
text:
Ah...
I'm so sorry for
the extra trouble~.

name: Sensettia
text:
There's no need for you to apologize.
It's a pretty common thing for us, so I
don't think the Nethers mind that much.

name: Sensettia
text:
More importantly, since you're here,
you should enjoy our festival!
It ended halfway yesterday!

name: Theoreol
text:
Well, weLL!
It's nice to see you again so soon, everyoNE.
This is excellent timiNG!

name: Theoreol
text:
Starting today, we're expanding
on the food that we offER.
There's a little surprise up for experienCE!

name: Sensettia
text:
Why are you advertising the surprise
instead of the taste of the food...?
W-Well, it is true—

name: Sensettia
text:
The mystery noodles that multiply as you eat,
and the candy that randomly changes flavor,
those certainly made an impact, but... Hey.

The gazes of Sensettia and the others,
who were still talking, focus on Turbak,
and silence falls.

name: Sensettia
text:
.........
...You, came again today.

name: Turbak
text:
...Sensettia, and
Viscunam, Theoreol.
Um, about yesterday...

In front of the three, with a
downcast expression, Turbak opens his mouth.
But, Sensettia interrupts him.

name: Sensettia
text:
Wait just a second!
If you're trying to apologize,
can you stop right there?

name: Viscunam
text:
I have no reason to consider the theories
of a fool who can't understand the goodness
of this festival. No apology is necessary...

name: Sensettia
text:
That's not what I mean!
Don't make things more complicated!

name: Viscunam
text:
Ouch!?
P-Pulling my beard is against the rules, young lady!
It's not that big of a deal!

Ignoring Viscunam who is clutching his beard,
Sensettia turns back to Turbak.

name: Sensettia
text:
I'll need to say some things first.
...Umm, it's not that I can't forgive you,
or that I'm angry, or anything like that.

name: Sensettia
text:
It's just that, just as you have
your thoughts, we also have our own thoughts.
I wanted you to know that.

name: Theoreol
text:
This festival is not being held
for the sake of Fortina.
About this conclusion you've reachED—

name: Theoreol
text:
We also didn't present
all the necessary informatiON.
So, since that's the caSE.

name: Theoreol
text:
Why don't you re-examine the
presented information, and see if
you would reach the same conclusiON?

options.text: Is that okay with you, Turbak?

name: Turbak
text:
...Thank you, all of you.
If you don't mind, could you tell me?
About what connects this festival, and Fortina itself.

At Turbak finally raising his face and smiling,
Sensettia and the others nod
and continue talking about the festival.

name: Sensettia
text:
Like I have told you yesterday,
this festival is a project
that Anonymous has started.

name: Roudin
text:
About this Anonymous.
I'm not really involved with villains,
so can you tell me a little more?

name: Barrel
text:
Ah...
If it's something you can't talk about in front of me,
I can step away for a bit~?

name: Viscunam
text:
I wouldn't really mind?
In the first place, we don't
know that much about them either.

name: Sensettia
text:
You'd probably know more about them, Barrel?
We barely access Anonymous for
anything other than transforming.

name: Theoreol
text:
Now, this will be a repeat of the
information I disclosed yesterday,
but Anonymous is a private network serviCE.

options.text: I thought it was something like a villain agency...

name: Sensettia
text:
It's completely different
from your usual hero agencies.
It's not even an organization.

name: Sensettia
text:
It's not open to the public,
so you'd probably never get involved with
it unless you accessed it yourself.

name: Viscunam
text:
The information that circulates there is diverse.
Anonymous people spouting information, without
the slightest regard for its authenticity.

name: Sensettia
text:
There's also a request board like the Link Board.
The source is unknown, so
we've never accepted any, though.

name: Theoreol
text:
They also offer a service equivalent
to 'LIVE@HERO', which is
what you'd use to streaM.

name: Theoreol
text:
Unlike a hero agency, there's
no dedicated 'Observer' for it, so
the observation is a bit unstabLE.

name: Barrel
text:
Yeah, yeah.
I learned about that in training,
so I know about it~!

name: Sensettia
text:
Well, just registering for Anonymous
doesn't automatically make you a villain.
And, this is the main point.

As Sensettia says, she
glances around and shifts her gaze
to the staff working at the pavilion.

name: Sensettia
text:
It's easy to misunderstand, but even if
you get Anonymous to transform you,
you wouldn't be a villain in the true sense.

name: Viscunam
text:
Even if they can transform, there are those
who belong to neither heroes nor villains.
The world perceives them as villains, though.

name: Sensettia
text:
Like I've told you yesterday, they're the Nethers.
The ones who are making this
festival so lively are those Nethers.

name: Turbak
text:
About that you've mentioned,
what do you mean that they can transform,
but they're not heroes or villains...?

options.text: Not a hero or a villain, huh...
I think I kind of get it.

name: Roudin
text:
Ah... I think I've got a clue.
Not everyone who can
transform wants to fight.

name: Roudin
text:
Transformation, is the power to gain help from one's own dreams.
And, to suddenly get that power,
and be told to fight monsters—

name: Roudin
text:
And, to be told to stream the form
of your dreams to the whole galaxy.
Isn't it natural for some to deny that?

options.text: I'd never thought about it before.
Well, I'm sure that a certain number of them do.

name: Sensettia
text:
If you join a hero agency,
you have to fight Kaibutsu
and villains.

name: Sensettia
text:
So there are quite a few people who just
register with Anonymous and live a normal
life, neither a hero nor a villain.

name: Theoreol
text:
This festival is mainly run by
those who are called Nethers.

name: Viscunam
text:
Gwahahaha!
They're a pretty impressive bunch, aren't they?
After all—

name: Viscunam
text:
They're not heroes or villains,
but they're achieving a level of excitement
that neither can achieve.

name: Sensettia
text:
And they want to surprise the whole
galaxy, to show that they're here.
This pavilion is a festival for those people.

name: Theoreol
text:
At that point, an offer of
cooperation came from Fortina.
Fortina may be a developing planet, buT—

name: Theoreol
text:
If the festival comes to a success,
they can introduce this festival when the
development is complete to some exteNT.

name: Roudin
text:
I see.
So they're developing their own
resources for tourism in advance.

name: Sensettia
text:
Of course, that's not all?
Fortina, to be honest,
isn't that rich of a star.

name: Sensettia
text:
It doesn't have any famous tourist spots or resources.
But still, they're working hard
to show that they're present.

name: Sensettia
text:
It's all those factors at hand, that
they wanted to make this pavilion's
festival Fortina's own festival.

name: Turbak
text:
...I see,
so that's what they were thinking.
They want to convey their feelings...

At Sensettia's words,
Turbak's expression is serious.
And, he bows deeply.

name: Turbak
text:
I'm very sorry about yesterday!
I've said some really terrible things
without even trying to find out!!

name: Sensettia
text:
Y-You don't have to apologize!
...But, I'll accept your feelings.
Thanks.

name: Turbak
text:
Now I've understood.
The festival at this pavilion
is the happiest thing ever!

Turbak's apology, and his smile.
And that smile makes its way
to the rest of the group.

name: Barrel
text:
It's great that everyone's on good terms~!
It was the right choice to come here today~.
Good job, officer~!!

name: Roudin
text:
Hehe, that's a great smile, Turbak.
With this, the exhibition match
after this is going to be exciting.

name: Turbak
text:
It's all thanks to you guys.
Thank you all for pulling me along with you.
And—

As he says, Turbak turns his smile
to Sensettia and the others.

name: Turbak
text:
Is there anything I can do for you?
As an apology... No, as a thank you for telling me
such a wonderful story, I'd do anything for you.

name: Barrel
text:
That's great~!
I'll help too~!
It sounds like fun~!!

name: Theoreol
text:
I didn't provide the information
in exchange for anything, so you don't
need to provide any labor, buT...

name: Viscunam
text:
Hold it there, Theoreol.
Kuku, Turbak, that's a good mindset.
—You really said 'anything', didn't you?

name: Roudin
text:
Hey, hey, I don't know what's going on,
but go easy on me, okay?

name: Viscunam
text:
What, it's nothing big.
I'm just giving you with a big role
that only a 'hero' can do.

Viscunam laughs as he says.
And, the heroes are
assigned a certain role.

name: Mafia?
text:
Kukuku...
What's with that lukewarm punch?
It doesn't even scratch my itch!

name: Guest
text:
Eh... What?
Isn't this an event where I
can experience being a hero...?

name: Villain?
text:
Too bad!
Your bonus time's over,
so cry and beg for your life!

The Fortina Pavilion, bustling with guests.
Suddenly, a scream echoes through the pavilion,
and a commotion spreads through the area.

name: Guest
text:
N-No way...!
S-Someone!
Someone help me!!

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text: That's as far as you go~!!

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
This Symphonic Trigger won't
allow for any more violence~!!

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
Now, come along quietly~!
You're under arrest~!!

name: Mafia?
text:
W-What, you!
If you're gonna interfere,
I won't go easy on you!!

name: Villain?
text:
Don't you see that
we have a hostage...
Huh? The hostage...?

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Surprising, yes?
Too bad, the hostage has
already been set free.

Barrel rushes to the guest's scream,
and Roudin and Turbak join him,
confronting the villains.

name: Turbak
text:
I won't let you turn the happy
memories of the festival into sad ones!
We will protect them!!
Battle Start

name: Villain?
text:
Gwah!!
S-Strong... Too strong...
*gasp*...

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
Alright, a-great-victory~!
Another page has been added to the
legend of Symphonic Trigger~!

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
You've done well.
For being a hero, here's
a little something for you... Hup!

Barrel defeats the villains,
and Roudin turns to the
shaken guest with a smile.

And, when Roudin takes out a single
flower out of nowhere for the guest
to accept, their face flushes with joy.

name: Guest
text:
Ah, thank you very much!
Wow, so this is the new project
I was told about at the entrance!

name: Guest
text:
I never thought I'd have a chance
to be rescued by a hero!!
I'm so glad I applied—!!

name: Turbak
text:
I'd be really glad if it became
a happy memory for you!
Here, take this commemorative item too!

name: Mafia?
text:
Thank you for participating
in the guerrilla live show.
We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Villain?
text:
There are still plenty of
rides, food, and sights to see,
so please enjoy the rest of your time!

options.text: Did that count as a thank you?

name: Mafia?
text:
Thanks for your help!
There was a talk on Anonymous
about trying a new project.

name: Villain?
text:
This time, it was a live show where
you get rescued by a hero.

name: Mafia?
text:
If the guests' response is good, we're thinking
of asking other pavilions for their cooperation.
We'll be counting on you again then!

As they say, the group sees off the
Nethers as they leave with smiles on their faces.
At that moment, Sensettia and the others appear.

name: Sensettia
text:
Good work!
It was pretty exciting, wasn't it!?

name: Viscunam
text:
Gwahahaha!
To become a hero,
and to be rescued by a hero...

name: Viscunam
text:
It's precisely because 'there are no heroes
here' that this entertainment is possible.
The Nethers are pretty good, aren't they?

name: Theoreol
text:
It's very interestiNG!
It's only a matter of time before we
take control of this event, Viscunam.

name: Sensettia
text:
We're done with that story.
I'm sure this guy has already
forgotten he said that...

options.text: We have to liven up Japan Pavilion too.
Everyone, let's do our best again!

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
We can't fall below either~!
Let's go back to the pavilion right away
and have a strategy meeting~!!

name: Turbak
text:
W-Wait a minute, Barrel-kun!
First, we have to go to the
exhibition match after this...!

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Haha, I know how Barrel feels.
For now... Hey, [Player].
Isn't your device ringing?

At Roudin's words,
[Player] checks their device.
It was an emergency call from Huckle.

options.text: Excuse me, I have to take this.
Is there some kind of trouble?

name: Huckle
text:
[Player]-kun.
Good work. If the heroes are nearby,
I'd like them to listen in as well.

name: Huckle
text:
It's an emergency.
—An incident has occurred, a guest
has been attacked by a villain.

name: Huckle
text:
I want you to act with the heroes,
and never leave their side.

name: Huckle
text:
As of now, the two pavilions that
were attacked are Clouge and Wehmalt.

name: Huckle
text:
Fortunately, the heroes on site
responded immediately. I hear that
the casualties are extremely light.

name: Huckle
text:
...However, there's a high possibility
that there are more of them in hiding.
The organizers are currently investigating the details.

name: Huckle
text:
I'll contact you again as soon as I have more information.
Again, don't leave the heroes' side,
and be extremely vigilant.

options.text: I'll share this with the heroes.
I'll check it out over here too!

text:
[Player] ends the call,
and the heroes around them,
who had also received the information,
check their devices with grim faces.

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
I got the info too~.
...They said there was a villain attack.

name: Turbak
text:
We got it from the agency too.
I don't know the details yet, but...

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
...First, we need more details.
I'm sure Clouge was attacked too, right?
Let's hear from those who were there.

As he says, Roudin operates his device
and contacts Nessen and the others,
who should be at Clouge Pavilion.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
You've worked hard, Roudin-sama.
If it's an emergency call, it must be
about the recent attack, correct?

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Apologize for bothering you
when you're busy cleaning up.
...We need some more details.

options.text: They said it was a villain attack...
Please tell us the situation in detail!

text:
At the voices of the group over the call,
Nessen politely explains the situation.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
First, there was a request for a guerrilla
live show from a certain pavilion.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
There were no problems with the
documents, so we readily accepted.
However—

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
They didn't show up at the scheduled time,
and when we tried to contact them, a commotion
broke out as guests were attacked.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
Fortunately, the number of attackers was small,
so we were able to respond ourselves.
The damage is also minor.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
There was someone who was injured from
falling during the evacuation, but they are
currently being taken to the first aid booth.

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
...Other than that, to prevent panic,
we've only announced that it was
an accident that occurred during the event.

name: Turbak
text:
...H-Hey, Nessen-san.
That pavilion, could it be...

name: Nessen (Masquerade)
text:
It's 'Fortina Pavilion'.
We're also investigating the details, so we'll
share any information as soon as we find it.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
...Roger that.
If we find out anything on our end,
we'll let you know. Thanks.

Nessen finishes his explanation.
A heavy silence falls over the
group who heard his words.

name: Sensettia
text:
W-We have no clue about this!
There was no talk on Anonymous
about attacking other pavilions...

name: Viscunam
text:
In the first place,
if I had known that was the purpose,
I wouldn't have accepted such a request.

name: Viscunam
text:
What I should be etching into history is my
great achievements, not my evil deeds.

name: Theoreol
text:
Hypothetically, if we were to conspire in an attack,
wouldn't we not publicize the guerrilla live shOW?
Since, that would be how suspicion ariSE.

At the words of the three answering
one after another, Barrel and the rest
of the group smile in return.

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
If I hadn't seen this pavilion,
I don't know what would have happened, but...
I believe in all of you~!!

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
You guys must have been set up too.
When you want to hide something, the theory is to
distract with something else flashy.

name: Turbak
text:
I... believe you too.
That your feelings for the festival are genuine,
that you just want people to have fun.

options.text: We have to find out the enemy's goal!

name: Theoreol
text:
I cannot be certain, but the attacker is
probably a registered member of Anonymous,
and is related to this festivAL.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Probably.
The attack was at the same time as
the new guerrilla live show here.

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
So you're saying they couldn't have planned it
unless they knew the internal information~.
Then, how do we find them~?

At Barrel's words, Roudin's
face clouds over for a moment, and then
he continues with his usual expression.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
I don't exactly know,
but I have a feeling.
Hey, you three.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
If you could, do a quick search on Anonymous.
An attack like this, wouldn't there
some kind of warning or something?

name: Sensettia
text:
I don't really mind, but just a sec.
Um, GCE... Warning...
Ah, what's this!?

As Sensettia says, she displays
her device's screen, and there,
a single post was displayed.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
'I'm going to destroy the world of heroes.
First, I'll destroy GCE, where heroes
are acting as advertisements themselves.'

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
'And next, 'LIVE@HERO',
and everything that turns heroes into
entertainment, I'll destroy it all...', huh.

name: Sensettia
text:
It looks like people think it's a prank?
In fact, no one seems to
have reacted to this post.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Maybe so.
...But it might be true.
Let's share it, just in case?

options.text: We need to share any information we have.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Roudin (Stella Link)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
If it's just a prank, it would be great.
We need information right now, so there's no harm in sharing even trivial things, right?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Roudin (Stella Link)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
If it's just a prank, it would be great.
We need information right now, so there's no harm in sharing even trivial things, right?

text:
At Roudin's words,
Barrel and Turbak also nod,
and each begins to act.

name: Barrel (Stella Link)
text:
No matter how small, it's still a clue...
I'll report it to the local police~!

name: Turbak
text:
I'll share this with the organizers...
the agency and the Archimedes Colony.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
Oh, that's a big help.
After that... We need to decide what to do
about the exhibition match after this.

name: Roudin (Stella Link)
text:
...Damn.
Destroy everything, huh...
